question: The three principal parts of an x-ray imaging sytem?
answer: Operating Console, High-voltage generator and the X-ray tube

question: It is desgned to provide a large number of electrons with high kinetic energy focused toward a small spot on the anode.
answer: Operating Console, High-voltage generator and the X-ray tube

question: The distance between the filament and the x-ray tube target is only approximately how many cm?
Electrons travelling from cathode to anode constitute the x-ray tube current and are sometimes called ?

T/F. Most of the kinetic energy of projectile electrons is converted to heat by interctions with outer-shell electrons of target atoms. These interactions are primarily excitations rather than ionization.
T/F. Approximately 99 % of the kinetic energy of projectile electrons is converted to heat.
If the projectile electron interacts with an inner-shell electron of the target atom rather than with an outer shell electron, ______ can be produced.
Result when the interaction is sufficiently violent to ionize the target atom though total removal of an inner shell electron.
Characteristic x-rays are emitted when an outer-shell electron fills an inner-shell void.
Only the K-characteristic x-rays of tungsten are useful for imaging.
X-rays result from electron transitions into the K shell
X-rays result from electron transitions into the L shell. Have much less energy than K x-rays.
This type of x-radiation is called ____ because it is characteristics of the target element.
X-rays result from the interaction between a projectile electron and a target nucleus. The electron is slowed , and its direction is changed.
X-rays are produced when a projectile electron is slowed by the nuclear field of a target atom nucleus.
Bremsstrahlung is a German word that means ?
Can be considered radiation that results from the braking of projectile electrons by the nucleus.
In the diagnostic range, most x-rays are bremsstrahlung x-rays
Bremsstrahlung x-rays can be produced at any ______.
A _____ contains only specific values.
Connecting the bars with a curve would indicate a large number of different types of balls. Such curve is called?
Refers to the range of types of balls or values of any quantity such as x-rays.
A ____ contains all possible values.
If one could stand in the middle of the useful x-ray beam , catch each individual x-ray , and measure its energy , one could describe what is known as the?
A plot of the frequency with which characteristics x-rays are emitted as a function of their energy. Such a plot is called?
Characteristic x-rays have precisely fixed (discrete) energies and form a discrete emission spectrum.
Bremsstrahlung x-rays have a range of energies and form a continuous emission spectrum.
The total number of x-rays emitted from an x-ray tube could be determined by adding together the number of x-rays emitted at each energy ove the entire spectrum, a proces called?
The farther to the right a spectrum is, the higher the effective energy or _____ of the x-ray beam.
The larger the area under the curve, the higher is the x-ray intensity or _____.
A change in mA or mAs result in a proportional change in the amplitude of the x-ray emission spectrum at all energies.
A change in kVp has no effect on the position of the discrete x-ray emission spectrum.
In the diagnostic range, a 15 %  increase kVp is equivalent to doubling the ___ to the image receptor.
Adding filtration is sometimes called ____ the x-ray beam because of the relative in average energy.
Five voltage waveforms ?
answer: Half-wave-rectified, full-wave rectified, three-phase/six pulse , three-phase/12 pulse , and high freuqnecy waveforms

question: Voltage waveforms are the same except for the frequency of x-ray pulse repetition.
Difference between three-phase / six pulse and three-phase/ 12 pulse power is?
answer: Simply the reduced ripple obtained with 12-pulse generation compared w/ six pulse generation

question: Emphasizes that its primary function is to accelerate electrons from the cathode to anode in the x-ray tube.

Five factors that affect the x-ray emission spectrum?
answer: mA and mAs, kVp, Added Filtration, Target material, Voltage Waveform

answer: Decrease in quantity, Increased in quality
